reviews.review: Does not live up to the hype. Terrible villain, too many characters, terrible ending, and filled with many forced and unfunny jokes.

Epic!
Draw dropping. 
Loved every minute of it
Worst ending in movie history. What a let-down. Wow. Shockingly unsatisfying.
Destiny arrives and it is pretty damn fun,thrilling,suspenseful,etc see at as soon has possible before someone spoils it for you
Best superhero movie ever. Ignore if anyone dislikes it like I could see few of the critics here. It is the best yet, waiting for part 2.

Excellent! Movie covers so much ground and so many characters. Everyone gets their due. Loved the Guardians portion. They add music, humor and irreverence to the originals. Lots of casualties but we still have the big four around to get revenge. Josh Brolin was tremendous as Thanos giving a nuanced performance as the bad guy with no interest in self enrichment.

The movie was too long and a bit of a mess. Too many story lines being threaded, which makes for a film with no cohesion.
Too many "super hero's" and not sure why Spider-Man, Captain America and the like, were in this film?
Some funny bits and a very confusing end?

If I was to sum up Avengers: Infinity War in two words, it would be: a mess.
If I was to go further, I could talk about the lack of character development (or any recognisable characters at all, really). I could talk about the rambling and disjointed plot; the film leaps between multiple plot lines like a rabbit on speed. I could talk about the jarring quote-unquote "humour". Most of all, I could talk about the dream-like, unrealistic quality of it all. Infinity War doesn't feel like a movie. It is so meandering, so meaningless, so extremely unrealistic that it feels more like a dream - or some extremely morbid fanfiction. Furthermore, Infinity War is not a movie for children. In fact, I sincerely feel sorry for every child who had to sit through that.

I'll be delving into spoiler territory now, so read on at your own peril.

One scene especially in this radioactive trashfire of a movie stood out to me. That was where the Guardians, following the Asgardians' distress signal, first encounter the wreckage of the ship. They watch the countless bodies floating by in horror. A genocide, an unspeakable tragedy, has occurred here.

Two minutes later, there's a running gag about whether Peter Quill is, in fact, overweight.

To call that "jarring" would be an understatement. I sat in the movie theatre shocked and wordless, unable to fully comprehend the idiocy which I had just witnessed with my own two eyes.

I give this one star because of the poor people who had to waste their talent making this film.

Good God.
FUJJING AMAZING. I was speechless after the movie
